Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: srit1
Reviews.Content: While I have successfully captured fantastic videos with 5 minutes between snapshots and 30 minutes, I have only a 67% success rate.  2 of the 6 videos came out all black.  70MB file, all black, 240 MB file, all black....  I cant figure out why this happened, but it certainly is something to be wary of if you are capturing once in a lifetime events.

Reviews.Title: Time Lapse for Dummies
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Great little time lapse camera.The camera is so easy to set up and begin time lapse photography.The camera comes with a flash drive that has two programs.1.  A .exe camera set-up file.  This will allow you to set the local date and time and a few simple camera settings.  Outdoor/or indoor lighting?  Compensates for fluorescent lights, incandescent or none (outdoors).  Low light on/off?  This is so it doesn't take pictures in complete darkness.  It also allows for one custom time interval for time lapse picture taking.  NOTE:  You can't use a Mac to tweak a .exe file (without running windows on a Mac).2.  A simple video viewer program to view the time lapse video created by the camera.  The camera creates .avi format files.  They can be viewed on a PC using the Brinno program.  It will also allow you to move through the video file one still picture at a time.  I haven't figured out how to take one or several still pictures out of the .avi file for use as separate pictures.  You don't have to use the Brinno software to view the .avi file.  Almost any program capable of viewing video files should work.  Quicktime works too.NOTE:  Each time you turn the camera on/off it will create a separate .avi time lapse video.  This means that you will need to be familiar with how to use a video editing software program to combine the files into one longer/complete video.  This is important if you are planning on a long project (home construction).  I'm currently practicing with iMovie to combine the .avi files, adjust timing, add music, trailers, etc.  It is simple to move the files from the flash drive via Mac/Finder or Windows/Explorer.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed for the price
Reviews.Author: Southern Gent "S.G."
Reviews.Content: Update 2/26/13I would not recommend this product IF you appreciate good design leading to good output. The camera does what it was intended to do, mostly, but it is not an easy path the user must take to get there. For example, the lack of a viewfinder makes framing the scene a hit-and-miss proposition as you must set it up, take a shot or two, review the shots, set it back up, wash, rinse repeat. Also, to change the rate at which shots are taken means you have to take off the back cover, remove the USB stick and use a thumbwheel; or plug the USB stick into your computer and have the software set the rate. Even then you have to move the thumbwheel to the "custom" setting, replace the USB stick and mount the rear cover, and THEN turn it back on. Finally, as I noted before, it is sometimes difficult to know whether you even turned the camera on and it is taking shots. More than once I was disappointed to discover that there was nothing on the USB stick. I'm just not impressed with this product AT THE PRICED I BOUGHT IT. If it were $50 then I could more easily forgive poor design. I"m dropping this item from 3 stars to 2.I literally just got it out of the box, set it up and it's now (hopefully) recording. That was all very easy and I think they did a great job of packaging and including the batteries and USB stick. However, see a couple of design flaws:1. No viewfinder. As someone mentioned in another review, this might be a serious limitation. I've got an idea of what I'm capturing but there's no way to know until I grab the USB stick and plug it into my laptop. We'll see if this is a fatal flaw.2. There's no way to know (that I know of) if it's actually recording. It would be nice to have it beep or make some noise or something. As it is now, I have it set on my office's window sill pointing out to the forest so I have no way of seeing the LED on the front. I guess I'll find out in a few minutes.I will update this review as I gain more experience with it. I hope it's a good replacement for my DSLR as I hate to "waste frames" doing time lapse with it and an intervalometer.

Reviews.Title: great camera and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: cheryl terry
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this camera to create a time lapse video of our house being built. Right out of the box, it was very simple to use. It only took a couple minutes to take our first photos. The software was just as easy, so viewing our first attempt was also user friendly. We have not used it outdoors for any prolong period of time; this with be an important test for us, as we hope to leave it outside for several weeks. But my first impressions are really favorable and I believe it will continue to perform well.

Reviews.Title: Not so bright
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera but...You have to set the Time and Date EVERY time you are going to use it. AT the time you are going to use it.You have to take the Thumb Drive out Set the Thumb Drive and put it in and Start it right away.Seems they were sure anyone that is, or would be using this camera would be setting up the Thumb drive and would be placing it straight from Laptop to the Camera and then turning the Camera On.If you wait 30 minutes, your pictures will be 30 minutes behind.The time is stamped on or from the thumb drive not the camera. Just annoying if you ask me.And meant for NOTHING but MOUNTED, LONG TERM Captures.

Reviews.Title: No view finder - is a design flaw you won't want to live with
Reviews.Author: Jay E Marowitz
Reviews.Content: Easy to use if you don't care about the results. There's no view finder, no LCD, nothing. You have to guess at where you're pointing the camera, run it for a while, look at the results, and, you guessed it, guess again - where you're pointing the camera.By 'look at the results', I mean: 1) open the camera back 2) take out the memory stick3) put it into your computer 4) run the film. If you don't like where the camera is pointing, you guessed it..If you don't like what you see, repeat the process until1) you get what you want2) you go crazy3) you throw the camera out in a ragewhichever comes firstThis could only have been designed by an idiot.

Reviews.Title: Solid product with a few flaws.
Reviews.Author: MDF
Reviews.Content: Yes, it would be great to have a viewfinder & maybe even an easier way to make sure it's running. At this price point it's unbeatable. It won't give you crystal clear perfectly balanced images, but it will get whatever job you want to show done. We used it to film an office being constructed all the way through finishing. We were able to cut together a nice video to announce our move / new address and everyone got a kick out of it. The only regret was that we didn't have a few to film different angles / things going on at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: John Maley
Reviews.Content: Clarity was much better than anticipated and was well worth the investment. I was surprised with the range and custom settings.

Reviews.Title: Just a viewer is missing in this product
Reviews.Author: Antonio Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Very good service, fast and secure. Just a viewer is missing. Very good price/quality. Very simple and usefull, a pleasure to work with

Reviews.Title: Does the trick, but low quality.
Reviews.Author: William Durham
Reviews.Content: It works, with very little work or setup time. The quality of the videos, though, are pretty weak. Also, although you can run it through a program to watch at different speeds, there is no way to output playback at different speeds, so you'd need a separate program to do that. If there is any direct light, it looks terrible and if there is low light, it doesn't perform well.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: wyzowl
Reviews.Content: Using a conventional camera with time lapse accessories is cumbersome and requires some user processing. This camera takes great time lapse sequences and they are automatically processed. It comes with software that allows for detailed viewing forward, backward, and at variable speeds. The videos can also be viewed with standard video play software.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: This camera was fine for my application to time lapse some construction.  Overall worked great once everything was set up.  As others have said, it doesn't have a viewfinder so you have to set it in a location, let it record for a while, then review to see if you like the position.  The quality of the video was excellent given the price of the camera.  I viewed the video on a 55" HD TV and it was great quality -- 4:3 ratio only, no 16:9 option, but for the price you can't have everything.Battery life was okay.  I set it to take a shot every 12 seconds which turns into 1 hour real time in 15 seconds play time.  Batteries lasted for one week of daytime recording which was fairly convenient as far as battery replacement goes.Pros:  Price, quality of video, ease of programming, standing up to weather, standard AA batteries used.Cons:  No viewfinder (set up, record, view to see if you have the location right), hard to see if camera is on during the day (green light is very dim and beeps are hard to hear outside).Would definitely recommend as a value time lapse camera as long as you spend the pre-time before you actually want to record to set the camera up.

Reviews.Title: It is a lot bigger that it looks. Hard ...
Reviews.Author: K2
Reviews.Content: It is a lot bigger that it looks.  Hard to tell if the power is actually on (I missed a sequence because the power was not actually on).

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Chuck Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a great product that works as advertised and is a bargain for what it does. I use the camera almost Daley to show progress on a project taking over a year.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the aggravation
Reviews.Author: Mike Jones
Reviews.Content: It dose take timelaps pictures. It does not adjust well to changing light conditions, the clairity is not what I had thought with a "HD" unit and the instruction booklet as well as the on line material was pathetic. The output needs to be converted to be used with other software. The lack of a viewfinder is very limiting but I know that going in.

Reviews.Title: Best for TimeLapse
Reviews.Author: gary a doss
Reviews.Content: I own three of these. They work very well for time-lapse. It is NOT designed as a trail cam. You can use it for that but unlike a trail cam these have to trigger feature.To date I have collected time-lapse video of my property, plants, assorted creatures, house construction, and security since 2009.Great fun and excellent as a learning tool.Rechargeable batteries are NOT a good choice. Fresh alkaline or lithium work best.One important note. If you set the low light option, and set the time wrong and it may only make exposures at night. I have had some wonderful night shots of total darkness!.The camera body is virtually weather proof. Take heed however if you mount it near the ground as mine filled with ants, in the base with the tripod mount. Only an issue if you don't notice and bring it in house.That being said, I can highly recommend this camera for both quality and price.

Reviews.Title: Brinno TLC100
Reviews.Author: 345am
Reviews.Content: wish i would have looked at item dimensions.  its twice as big as i expected.  brinno performs well however.  setup software a bit awkward since brinno doesn't have LCD screen. thought about returning, but think i'll keep it & work with its limitations

Reviews.Title: Brinno Time-Lapse
Reviews.Author: Kinnan
Reviews.Content: This camera seemed like the ideal blend of trail cam and video camera. I had hoped to be able to leave it out for a week and come back and have an entire week's worth of video. Not so. I will have to make sure that I turn off the night feature and download the video every 4,096 frames, which is the maximum for each video file. Once it reaches that magic number, it is done. So - not great for remote areas.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Product -- Even Worse Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Craig A. Parker
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras to create a time lapse record of a house we were building.  The cameras come with proprietary software that is required in order to even operate the camera.  Both cameras refuse to function.  I have followed the instructions in the (very poorly written and uninformative) users manual and have attempted multiple times to contact the company.I finally got a response from the company's distributor a month after my last email.  The response was that they were going to pass my request for help along to an engineer.  Meanwhile, my house is nearly done.What a joke.  Do not purchase this product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: DCBPYNO
Reviews.Content: A fun idea with a decent image but very unreliable. Shuts off randomly, which, if you're trying to document something important, makes this product useless. Don't waste your money.
